workflow.name: Automated Facebook message response with GPT-4o and Airtable inventory matching
workflow.description:
## üìò Description
 This workflow automates AI-driven Facebook Messenger product inquiry handling, connecting Facebook DMs with Airtable inventory and returning instant automated replies based on product availability.
 It runs hourly, fetches new messages, extracts the latest customer query, uses GPT-4o to identify the product and intent, merges this with the Airtable inventory dataset, performs an AI-assisted product match, and replies automatically inside the same Facebook conversation.
 Invalid or malformed messages are logged to Google Sheets for review.

## ‚öôÔ∏è What This Workflow Does (Step-by-Step)

‚ñ∂Ô∏è Trigger ‚Äì Fetch New Facebook Messages (Every Hour)
 Schedules hourly polling of new conversations from Facebook Messenger.

üü¶ Fetch Facebook Conversation List (Graph API)
 Retrieves conversation threads from the connected Facebook Page.

üí¨ Fetch Facebook Conversation Messages (Graph API)
 Loads message details (content, sender, timestamp) for the selected conversation.

üì© Extract Latest Facebook Message (Code)
 Sorts all messages and picks the latest one ‚Üí this is the message analyzed by AI.

üîç Validate Record Structure (IF)
 Ensures the incoming message has required fields.
 Valid ‚Üí AI analysis
 Invalid ‚Üí logged to Google Sheets.

üìÑ Log Invalid Records to Google Sheet
 Stores malformed or unprocessable messages for audit and correction.

üß† Configure GPT-4o ‚Äî Message Classification Model
 Defines AI model used to extract product details and intent from the customer‚Äôs message.

ü§ñ AI ‚Äì Extract Product & Customer Intent
 AI identifies:
product name (standardized)
customer intent (availability, pricing, inquiry)
cleaned query
always returns structured JSON
No inventory lookup happens here.

üì¶ Fetch Inventory Records from Airtable
 Pulls complete product inventory list to cross-match with customer request.

üîÅ Merge AI Output With Inventory Dataset
 Combines:
AI-interpreted message data
Airtable inventory records
 This prepares a unified object for product lookup.

üìù Build Combined AI + Inventory Payload (Code)
 Constructs { ai: {...}, inventory: [...] } for the product-matching AI agent.

üß† Configure GPT-4o ‚Äî Product Matching Model
 Sets strict rules for identifying whether the requested product exists in inventory.

ü§ñ AI ‚Äì Match Requested Product in Inventory
 AI checks:
exact / close match to product name
whether item exists
generates structured JSON reply text + confidence score.

üßπ Parse AI Product Match JSON (Code)
 Ensures the AI output is valid JSON before making decisions.

üîç Check If Product Exists (IF)
 If found ‚Üí sends ‚Äúproduct available‚Äù reply
 If not ‚Üí sends ‚Äúproduct not found‚Äù reply.

üì® Send Facebook Reply ‚Äî Product Found (Graph API)
 Sends a personalized Messenger reply including matched product details.

üì® Send Facebook Reply ‚Äî Product Not Found (Graph API)
 Replies politely informing customer that the product is not available.

## üß© Prerequisites
- Facebook Graph API access token
- Airtable API token
- Azure OpenAI GPT-4o credentials
- Google Sheets OAuth

## üí° Key Benefits
 ‚úî Fully automated Facebook DM handling
 ‚úî AI-powered product identification even with typos or unclear wording
 ‚úî Real-time product availability responses
 ‚úî Unified Airtable-driven catalog lookup
 ‚úî Automatic fallback for invalid messages
 ‚úî Zero manual intervention for customer support

## üë• Perfect For
- Ecommerce stores
- Catalog-based product businesses
- Teams handling large volumes of Facebook DM inquiries
- Businesses wanting instant customer replies without agents

workflow.name: AI-Driven Facebook DM ‚Üí Inventory Matching & Automated Messaging System

nodes.name: Trigger ‚Äì Fetch New Facebook Messages (Every Hour)

parameters.text:
=You received this customer message:

"{{ $json.message }}"

Extract the following:

1. The product the customer is asking for.
2. The intent (ex: availability, price inquiry, general question).
3. The cleaned product name (lowercase, no extra words).
4. Return ONLY a JSON object.

Example format to return:

{
  "query": "...",
  "product_name": "...",
  "intent": "...",
  "found": false
}

options.systemMessage:
=You are an AI assistant that extracts product-related information
from a customer's message.

Rules:
1. Identify the product name ‚Äî be flexible with typos.
2. Detect the customer's intent (ex: availability, price, inquiry).
3. Always return clean JSON only ‚Äî no explanation text.
4. Set "found": false because inventory is checked in the next step.

nodes.name: Merge AI Output With Inventory Dataset
AI ‚Äì Match Requested Product in Inventory

parameters.text:
=Here is the combined data from the customer query and the inventory:

Customer Query:
- Product Name: "{{ $json.ai.product_name }}"
- Intent: "{{ $json.ai.intent }}"

Inventory List:
{{ JSON.stringify($json.inventory) }}

Your job:
1. Determine if the requested product exists in the inventory.
2. If found, return the item details.
3. If not found, return found: false.
4. Generate a clear human-friendly message.

Return ONLY valid JSON in this exact structure:

{
  "product_name": "",
  "found": true or false,
  "matched_item": {},     // empty object if not found
  "reply": "",
  "confidence": 0-100
}

options.systemMessage:
=You are an AI product lookup assistant.

You analyze a customer‚Äôs product request and match it against the provided inventory.

Rules:
- Only consider exact or close product name matches.
- If the product exists, return found: true, and include the matching inventory object.
- If the product doesn't exist, return found: false and matched_item = {}.
- Always return clean JSON exactly as requested.
- No extra explanations.

nodes.name: Send Facebook Reply ‚Äî Product Not Found
Log Invalid Records to Google Sheet

parameters.content:
## ü§ñ AI-Driven Facebook DM ‚Üí Inventory Matching & Automated Messaging System

This workflow automatically fetches new Facebook messages, extracts the customer‚Äôs intent,
matches product names against Airtable inventory, and sends an instant automated reply.

### üîπ Workflow Summary
1. Trigger every hour ‚Üí fetch latest Facebook conversations  
2. Extract the most recent customer message  
3. Use GPT-4o to detect the requested product + intent  
4. Pull full Inventory list from Airtable  
5. Merge AI interpretation + inventory dataset  
6. AI checks if the requested product exists  
7. Sends a Facebook reply ‚Üí ‚ÄúProduct found‚Äù or ‚ÄúNot found‚Äù  
8. Invalid or bad-structured messages get logged in Google Sheets  

### üîπ Integrations Used
‚Ä¢ Facebook Graph API ‚Äî Message read/write  
‚Ä¢ Azure GPT-4o ‚Äî Intent extraction + product lookup  
‚Ä¢ Airtable ‚Äî Product catalog  
‚Ä¢ Google Sheets ‚Äî Invalid data logging  

This workflow enables instant, automated customer support for product availability.

## Intake & Validation ‚Äî Facebook Messages  
Fetches new customer conversations every hour and retrieves the latest message.  
Validates message structure (id, fields).  
If invalid ‚Üí logs to Google Sheets; if valid ‚Üí sent to the AI intent extraction step.

## AI Intent Understanding ‚Äî Message Analysis  
Uses GPT-4o to identify the product mentioned, customer intent,  
and generate a clean structured JSON output.  
Ensures consistent extraction even with typos, slang, or unclear text.

## Inventory Matching ‚Äî AI + Airtable Dataset  
Combines interpreted customer query with full Airtable inventory.  
AI checks if the requested product exists using clean product-name comparison.  
Outputs a structured decision object with match details and reply text.

## Auto-Reply Delivery ‚Äî Facebook Messenger  
Sends a real-time automated Messenger reply based on product availability.  
If matched ‚Üí sends product details;  
If not ‚Üí replies with a polite ‚Äúnot available‚Äù message.

main.node: Send Facebook Reply ‚Äî Product Not Found
Log Invalid Records to Google Sheet

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
